Package com.google.inject.tools.suite.module

Classes for representing and managing modules in the user's code.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
CustomModuleContextRepresentation Represents a custom module context defined by the user.
ModuleContextRepresentation Representation of a module context in the user's code.
ModuleManager Responsible for tracking the modules which should be run when resolving bindings and injections.
ModuleManager.PostUpdater A piece of code to run after an update has completed.
ModuleRepresentation Representation of a module context in the user's code.
ModulesSource Responsible for listening to changes in the user's code involving Modules.
ModulesSource.ModulesSourceListener Listener for changes in the modules available.
 

Class Summary
ClassNameUtility Utility for manipulating class names.
ModuleContextRepresentation.ModuleInstanceRepresentation Representation of an instance of a Module in the user's code, including which constructor to use and how to use it.
ModuleManagerFactoryImpl Factory to create ModuleManagers with preconstructed JavaManagers.
 

Exception Summary
ModuleManager.NoJavaManagerException An exception thrown if the ModuleManager is accessed before it has a JavaManager attached.
 

Package com.google.inject.tools.suite.module Description

Classes for representing and managing modules in the user's code.

Modules in the user's code are managed by the ModuleManager which is injected as a singleton. The ModuleSelectionView and ModulesSource interfaces must be implemented by IDE specific classes to notify the manager of changes in the user's code and configuration.

Modules are represented by the ModuleRepresentation class and module contexts, i.e. guice contexts that injectors are created in are represented by ModuleContextRepresentation. ModuleRepresentations are created for each module in the user's code. ModuleContextRepresentations are created for each context the user specifies to use the plugin for.
